item.title: Threshold knot selection for large-scale spatial models with applications to the Deepwater Horizon disaster
item.description:
Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.
Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.

I’m a Statistician, currently working as an Assistant Professor of Biostatistics at West Virginia University. My main research interests are spatial statistics and statistical computing, but I also enjoy playing in everyone else’s backyard (i.e. collaborations). The backyards I tend to play in most are Forensics and medical applications. I know, that’s kind of broad. But working on the health science campus of a university tends to lead to a lot of researchers who need statistical help, and few who can provide it.
